column4: can anyone offer me some help , on how to run a .tar file in terminal

joeb3 go to new window

hahaha
wasn't mockin you mate... just found it funny
read: been there, done that..
why don't you just rm that file and install vuze from the repos?

try this... open terminal and cd into the particular directory, where you saved that file. then run "sudo rm Vuze_Installer.tar.bz2" enter your admin password and the file should be gone. the run "sudo aptitude install vuze" and you should have it!
do you know how to use the terminal?
version?
could you explain why are you trying to do so?
use terminal. do you know how?
the problem sits between the chair and keyboard. many people have devoted their time to helping you and you just keep on flooding. sorry man.
